Address.college_name: Concordia University

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1974 by the merger of Sir George Williams University, founded 1948, and Loyola College of Montreal, incorporated 1896
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: Regular session, September to April (September-December; January-April); summer session, May to August)
AdmissionRequirements: Diploma of Collegial Studies (DEC) following successful completion of a 2-year pre-university course at a CEGEP (Collège d'Enseignement général et professionnel), or recognized equivalent

Divisions.College: Ethnographic Research and Exhibition in the Aftermath of Violence
Research/Creation In Media Arts and Technologies

Address.college_name: University of Sherbrooke

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1954. Recognized as a Catholic University through a decree 1957.
AdmissionRequirements: Diploma of Collegial Studies (DEC) following successful completion of a 2-year pre-university course at a CEGEP (Collège d'Enseignement général et professionnel), or recognized equivalent

Divisions.College: Monitoring of the Environment and Sustainable Development
Research and Training in Disability Prevention

Address.college_name: Bishop's University

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1843 as Bishop's College, constituted as a university by Royal Charter with power to confer degrees 1853.
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: September to April (September-December; January-April). Also 2 Summer Sessions (May-August)
AdmissionRequirements: Collegial Diploma (DEC), or recognized foreign equivalent

Divisions.College: Modélisation en Imagerie, Vision et Réseaux de neurones
Modern History of Europe and Africa
Stellar Astrophysics and Relativity Research Cluster

Address.college_name: Institute of Theological Training of Montreal
Address.university_name: Institut de Formation Théologique de Montréal (IFTM)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1840 as Grand Seminary of Montreal. Became headquarters of the Faculty of Theology 1878. Attached to the Université Laval of Quebec it was then recognised as a Faculty of the University of Montreal as of 1920. Affiliated to the Faculty of Theology of the Pontifical University of Latran as of 1979 an to the Faculty of Philosophy of the Pontifical University of Latran as of 1986. The Centre for Theological Formation was transformed into an Institute was 1988 and acquired present title 1995. Granted the right to offer civil degrees 1998. Acquired autonomy 2009.

Address.college_name: Laval University

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1663 as Grand Séminaire de Québec. Granted royal Charter 1852. Granted a new charter by the Assemblée Nationale du Québec 1970; modified 1991. Financed by a Provincial Grant.
AdmissionRequirements: Diploma of Collegial Studies (DEC) following successful completion of a 2-year pre-university course at a CEGEP (Collège d'Enseignement général et professionnel), or recognized equivalent

Divisions.College: Languages, Arts and Popular Francophone Traditions of North America
Research and Intervention on Academic Success
Violence Against Women and Family Violence

Address.college_name: McGill University

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1821 as University of McGill College. A corporation created by Royal Charter granted by the United Kingdom Crown and exercised through the Governor-General as 'visitor'.
AdmissionRequirements: Diploma of Collegial Studies (DEC) following successful completion of a 2-year pre-university course at a CEGEP (Collège d'Enseignement général et professionnel) in Quebec, or high school diploma with university entrance

Address.college_name: Université du Québec – Engineering School - University of Quebec
Address.university_name: Ecole de Technologie supérieure - Université du Québec (ETS)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1974. An Engineering School, part of the University of Quebec network specialized in applied engineering and technology. Cooperative education system with work-study programme.
AdmissionRequirements: Diploma of Collegial Studies (DEC) following successful completion of 3-year pre-university course in physical technology or technology of computer-controlled systems, at a CEGEP (Collège d'Enseignement général et professionnel) in Quebec, or recognized equivalent

Production of Francis Turbine Shroud Ring/ Fabrication de couronnes de turbine Francis

Address.college_name: Université du Québec – National School of Public Administration - University of Québec
Address.university_name: Ecole nationale d'Administration publique - Université du Québec (ENAP)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1969. A Postgraduate Constituent School of the University of Quebec
AdmissionRequirements: Diploma of Collegial Studies (DEC) following successful completion of a 2-year pre-university course at a CEGEP (Collège d'Enseignement général et professionnel), or recognized equivalent

Address.college_name: Université du Québec – Institut national de la Recherche scientifique - Université du Québec
Address.university_name: National Institute of Scientific Research - University of Quebec (INRS)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1969. A Postgraduate Research Institute constituent of the University of Quebec
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: Summer semester (May to August); Autumn semester (September to December); Winter semester (January to April)
AdmissionRequirements: University degree at Bachelor level for Master's level programmes; Master's degree for doctoral programmes

Address.college_name: University of Montreal

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1878 as a branch of Laval University. Became autonomous 1919 and acquired present status and title 1967. A public institution. The largest French-speaking university outside France.
AdmissionRequirements: Diploma of Collegial Studies (DEC) following successful completion of a 2-year pre-university course at a CEGEP (Collège d'enseignement général et professionnel), or recognized equivalent

Address.university_name: Université de Montréal – Ecole polytechnique de Montréal – Polytechnique Montréal

Address.college_name: University of Montreal – HEC Montreal

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1907 as Ecole des Hautes Etudes Commerciales de Montréal. Acquired present name 2002. Affiliated to the University of Montreal.
AdmissionRequirements: Depending on programmes; information available from the institution

Address.college_name: University of Quebec

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1968 by an Act of the National Assembly of the Province of Quebec, the University is the Province's first public university but it is self-governing and reports to the State each year. The University of Quebec groups 10 institutions (6 comprehensive universities, 1 research institute and 2 schools and 1 distance education institution Télé-université (TÉLUQ)). The traditional university organization by Faculties and Schools has been replaced by a structure composed of 3 elements: Departments, Modules and Research Centres. The Module is responsible for administration of First Degree programmes (1er cycle) while Departments and Research Centres (concerned with higher Degrees) are respectively responsible for teaching and research of any given discipline
AdmissionRequirements: Diploma of Collegial Studies (DEC) following successful completion of 2 yrs pre-university course at a CEGEP (Collège d'Enseignement général et professionnel), or recognized equivalent

Address.college_name: University of Quebec – TÉLUQ university
Address.university_name: Université du Québec – TÉLUQ université – Télé-université (TÉLUQ)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1972 as a "commission" of Université du Québec. Its mandate: the development and dissemination of distance-learning university courses. In 1992 TELUQ obtained its letters patent. It is granted the status of graduate school and its double mission of education and research is confirmed. In 2005 TÉLUQ merged with Université du Québec in Montreal (UQAM). In 2012, TÉLUQ received new letters patent and completed autonomy as a university in the Université du Québec, network

Address.college_name: University of Quebec – University of Quebec - Chicoutimi
Address.university_name: Université du Québec – Université du Québec - Chicoutimi (UQAC)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1969. A Constituent University of the University of Quebec
AdmissionRequirements: Diploma of Collegial Studies (DEC) following successful completion of a 2-year pre-university course at a CEGEP (Collège d'Enseignement général et professionnel), or recognized equivalent

Divisions.College: Ambient Intelligence for Recognition of Activities
Atmospheric Icing and Engineering of Electrical Networks

Address.college_name: University of Quebec – University of Quebec - Montreal
Address.university_name: Université du Québec – Université du Québec - Montréal (UQAM)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1969, incorporating 5 existing institutions. The University gained 'associate university' status in the University of Quebec network 1989, giving it greater autonomy
AdmissionRequirements: Diploma of Collegial Studies (DEC) following successful completion of a 2-year pre-university course at a CEGEP (Collège d'Enseignement général et professionnel), or recognized equivalent (13 years of study); if only 12, one year of transition courses (30 credits) before admission to bachelor's programme; or 22 years of age and appropriate experience or basic university studies

Divisions.College: International Center for Tourism Education and Research
Research on Immigration, Ethnicity and Citizenship

Address.college_name: University of Quebec – University of Quebec - Outaouais
Address.university_name: Université du Québec – Université du Québec - Outaouais (UQO)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1970 as Services universitaires dans le nord-ouest québécois, reorganized several times and acquired present status and title 2002. A Constituent University of the University of Quebec
AdmissionRequirements: Undergraduate programmes, Diploma of Collegial Studies (DEC) following successful completion of a 2-year pre-university course at a CEGEP (Collège d'enseignement général et professionnel), or recognized equivalent

Address.college_name: University of Quebec – University of Quebec - Rimouski
Address.university_name: Université du Québec – Université du Québec - Rimouski (UQAR)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded as Centre d'Etudes universitaires de Rimouski, 1969. Acquired present status and title 1973. A Constituent University of the University of Quebec
AdmissionRequirements: Diploma of Collegial Studies (DEC) following successful completion of a 2-year pre-university course at a CEGEP (Collège d'Enseignement général et professionnel), or recognized equivalent

Address.university_name: Université du Québec – Université du Québec - Trois-Rivières (UQTR)

Address.college_name: University of Quebec – University of Quebec - Abitibi-Témiscamingue
Address.university_name: Université du Québec – Université du Québec en Abitibi-Témiscamingue (UQAT)

GeneralInformation.History: Active from 1970 as Services universitaires dans le Nord-Ouest québécois, reorganized as Direction des études universitaires dans l'Ouest québécois 1972, as Centre d'études universitaires dans l'Ouest québécois 1976, as Centre d'études universitaires en Abitibi-Témiscamingue 1981 and acquired present status and title 1983, a Constituent University of the University of Quebec
AdmissionRequirements: Diploma of Collegial Studies (DEC) following successful completion of a 2-year pre-university course at a CEGEP (Collège d'Enseignement général et professionnel), or recognized equivalent
